result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua J Knorr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Extended Supervision and Probation conditions same

miscConds.notes: Pay all costs, fees and assessments, any cash bail to apply, pay supervision fees as determined by the Wisconsin Department of Corrections. The Court ordered that all appropriate costs, surcharges and special assessments be paid from up to 25% of all inmate funds and as a condition of Extended Supervision.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.

No new violations of law rising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with Tracy K. or Amber K. Agent may modify No Contact Order upon request of victims and based upon compliance with supervision.

Cooperate with the Department of Corrections.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Undergo random urine screens.
Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
Attend the following programs and/or assessments: AODA.

timeConds.notes: Release privileges for medical appointments only under condition of absolute sobriety, with good time credit.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joshua J Knorr in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Joshua J Knorr in custody.  Tyrone Martin St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  On State's motion, Court ordered COUNT 2 DISMISSED AND READ IN.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by counsel, the defendant and the court.  The Court imposed the following sentence:  The Court imposes the following Bifurcated Sentence:
Defendant's TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE shall be 4 YEARS consecutive to any other sentence.  Defendant's TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin Prison System shall be for 2 YEARS with credit for 78 days time served.  Defendant shall serve 2 YEARS on EXTENDED SUPERVISION.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  The Court ordered that all appropriate costs, surcharges and special assessments be paid from up to 25% of all inmate funds and as a condition of Extended Supervision.   The Court advised the defendant of his determinate sentence pursuant to statute and in accordance with Form CR-234.  Copy provided to defendant.  The Court STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation to the State Department of Corrections for a period of 30 MONTHS.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION & EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
- As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 7 MONTHS in the House of Correction, release privileges for medical appointments only under condition of absolute sobriety, with good time credit.
- No new violations of law rising to the level of probable cause.
- Attend the following programs and/or assessments:  AODA.
- Cooperate with the Department of Corrections.
- Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.   No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
- Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
- Undergo random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with Tracy K. or Amber K.  Agent may modify No Contact Order upon request of victims and based upon compliance with supervision.
- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
- Pay supervision fees as determined by the Wisconsin Department of Corrections.
- Pay all costs, fees and assessments, any cash bail to apply.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.
- Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief. 
Filed,
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Joshua J Knorr not in court, in custody.  Tyrone Martin St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  On courts motion, trial rescheduled to JULY 14, 2014, 8:30am.  kmw  Jury trial scheduled for July 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant in court with Attorney Michael Jude, defendant in custody.  James Griffin for the State.  During plea colloquy, court finds there is no basis for a plea and orders plea vacated.  Case remains calendared for trial on JULY 9, 2014, 9AM.  kmw

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Joshua J Knorr not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Alexis Liggins for Michael Jude in court, defendant Joshua J Knorr not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendants motion to modify bail heard and DENIED.  Upon defendant filing verifications as to a scheduled surgery date and a statement as to urgency of the procedure, the court will reconsider.  Status conference scheduled for June 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joshua J Knorr in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Joshua J Knorr in custody.  Jesica Ballenger for James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Tracie K., Amber K. and the address of 5032 N. 67th St., Milwaukee, WI.

Defendant Joshua J Knorr in court with attorney Matthew A Lamke.  Defendant Joshua J Knorr in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant enters a plea of not guilty as to misdemeanor count 2.
Defendant to provide his current address at the next court date.
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.
